TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListViewItemSelectionChangedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ItemSelectionChanged> event occurs when the selection state of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> changes from selected to deselected or deselected to selected. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ItemSelectionChanged> will not occur if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is in virtual mode.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this type. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ItemSelectionChanged> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> named `ListView1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ItemSelectionChanged> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#478](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#478)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#478](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#478)]
